speaker: TIMON
text_entry: SCENE V. The same. The senate-house. The Senate sitting.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: My lord, you have my voice to it; the fault's

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Bloody; 'tis necessary he should die:

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Nothing emboldens sin so much as mercy.

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Most true; the law shall bruise him.

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Enter ALCIBIADES, with Attendants

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Honour, health, and compassion to the senate!

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Now, captain?

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: I am an humble suitor to your virtues;

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: For pity is the virtue of the law,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: And none but tyrants use it cruelly.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: It pleases time and fortune to lie heavy

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Upon a friend of mine, who, in hot blood,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Hath stepp'd into the law, which is past depth

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: To those that, without heed, do plunge into 't.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: He is a man, setting his fate aside,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Of comely virtues:

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Nor did he soil the fact with cowardice--

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: An honour in him which buys out his fault--

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: But with a noble fury and fair spirit,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Seeing his reputation touch'd to death,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: He did oppose his foe:

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: And with such sober and unnoted passion

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: He did behave his anger, ere 'twas spent,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: As if he had but proved an argument.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: You undergo too strict a paradox,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Striving to make an ugly deed look fair:

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Your words have took such pains as if they labour'd

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: To bring manslaughter into form and set quarrelling

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Upon the head of valour; which indeed

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Is valour misbegot and came into the world

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: When sects and factions were newly born:

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: He's truly valiant that can wisely suffer

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: The worst that man can breathe, and make his wrongs

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: His outsides, to wear them like his raiment,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: carelessly,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: And ne'er prefer his injuries to his heart,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: To bring it into danger.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: If wrongs be evils and enforce us kill,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: What folly 'tis to hazard life for ill!

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: My lord,--

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: You cannot make gross sins look clear:

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: To revenge is no valour, but to bear.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: My lords, then, under favour, pardon me,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: If I speak like a captain.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Why do fond men expose themselves to battle,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: And not endure all threats? sleep upon't,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: And let the foes quietly cut their throats,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Without repugnancy? If there be

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Such valour in the bearing, what make we

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Abroad? why then, women are more valiant

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: That stay at home, if bearing carry it,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: And the ass more captain than the lion, the felon

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Loaden with irons wiser than the judge,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: If wisdom be in suffering. O my lords,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: As you are great, be pitifully good:

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Who cannot condemn rashness in cold blood?

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: To kill, I grant, is sin's extremest gust;

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: But, in defence, by mercy, 'tis most just.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: To be in anger is impiety;

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: But who is man that is not angry?

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Weigh but the crime with this.

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: You breathe in vain.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: In vain! his service done

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: At Lacedaemon and Byzantium

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Were a sufficient briber for his life.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: What's that?

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: I say, my lords, he has done fair service,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: And slain in fight many of your enemies:

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: How full of valour did he bear himself

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: In the last conflict, and made plenteous wounds!

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: He has made too much plenty with 'em;

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: He's a sworn rioter: he has a sin that often

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: Drowns him, and takes his valour prisoner:

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: If there were no foes, that were enough

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: To overcome him: in that beastly fury

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: He has been known to commit outrages,

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: And cherish factions: 'tis inferr'd to us,

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: His days are foul and his drink dangerous.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: He dies.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Hard fate! he might have died in war.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: My lords, if not for any parts in him--

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Though his right arm might purchase his own time

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: And be in debt to none--yet, more to move you,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Take my deserts to his, and join 'em both:

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: And, for I know your reverend ages love

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Security, I'll pawn my victories, all

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: My honours to you, upon his good returns.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: If by this crime he owes the law his life,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Why, let the war receive 't in valiant gore

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: For law is strict, and war is nothing more.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: We are for law: he dies; urge it no more,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: On height of our displeasure: friend or brother,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: He forfeits his own blood that spills another.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Must it be so? it must not be. My lords,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: I do beseech you, know me.

speaker: Second Senator
text_entry: How!

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Call me to your remembrances.

speaker: Third Senator
text_entry: What!

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: I cannot think but your age has forgot me;

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: It could not else be, I should prove so base,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: To sue, and be denied such common grace:

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: My wounds ache at you.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Do you dare our anger?

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: 'Tis in few words, but spacious in effect;

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: We banish thee for ever.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Banish me!

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Banish your dotage; banish usury,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: That makes the senate ugly.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: If, after two days' shine, Athens contain thee,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Attend our weightier judgment. And, not to swell

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: our spirit,

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: He shall be executed presently.

speaker: First Senator
text_entry: Exeunt Senators

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Now the gods keep you old enough; that you may live

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Only in bone, that none may look on you!

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: I'm worse than mad: I have kept back their foes,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: While they have told their money and let out

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Their coin upon large interest, I myself

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Rich only in large hurts. All those for this?

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Is this the balsam that the usuring senate

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Pours into captains' wounds? Banishment!

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: It comes not ill; I hate not to be banish'd;

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: It is a cause worthy my spleen and fury,

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: That I may strike at Athens. I'll cheer up

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: My discontented troops, and lay for hearts.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: 'Tis honour with most lands to be at odds;

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Soldiers should brook as little wrongs as gods.

speaker: ALCIBIADES
text_entry: Exit
